findings.title: RSK - Redundant Storage Keyword
findings.description: The contract uses the `storage` keyword in a view function, which is unnecessary and can make the code less readable.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the `constant` keyword, which can decrease gas consumption and ensure their values cannot be changed.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The contract does not follow the Solidity naming conventions, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L05 - Unused State Variable
findings.description: An unused state variable is declared in the contract, which can increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: The contract contains dead code, which can make it more difficult to understand and maintain.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of precision.

findings.title: L15 - Local Scope Variable Shadowing
findings.description: Local scope variable shadowing can lead to confusion and unintended consequences if not used correctly.

findings.title: L17 - Usage of Solidity Assembly
findings.description: Using assembly can be error-prone and difficult to read and understand compared to Solidity code.

findings.title: L18 - Multiple Pragma Directives
findings.description: Including multiple conflicting pragma directives can produce unexpected errors.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The `^` symbol in the pragma directive can cause issues with compatibility and stability.
